attachments.text: `<https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/STREAM/commit/6880286448e6235515318744a0d283d05839e4e6|68802864>` - Add related urls and Equalifed attribute

We are standardizing our data architecture with <https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/STREAM|https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/STREAM>

I think <http://scan.equalify.app|scan.equalify.app> is the best place to handle converting results from axe-core's default output to STREAM. Is that right?

I've already built the conversion logic: <https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/STREAM/blob/main/stream-app/converters/axe-core.js|https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/STREAM/blob/main/stream-app/converters/axe-core.js>

<https://github.com/azdak|@azdak> - if you don't have any objections to handling the conversion in `scan.equalify`, go ahead and update `/dev` to handle it. I am refactoring the data architecture for STREAM now: <https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify/issues/300|EqualifyEverything/equalify#300>
attachments.title: <https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/scan.equalify.app/issues/25|#25 Return Results in STREAM?>

attachments.text:
To give folks the ability to just add their website URL, we would look for a sitemap if it wasn’t supplied with the url.

Here are three things before processing a sitemap:

1. look to see if the url is a sitemap or sitemap index. If yes, skip the next two steps and just process the site map.
2. If no, see if a sitemap is available at “/sitemap.xml”. If yes, process the sitemap.
3. If still no, look at "/wp-sitemap.xml". If no, you return the error as you already do.

attachments.text:
To give folks the ability to just add their website URL, we would look for a sitemap if it wasn’t supplied with the url.

Here are three things before processing a sitemap:

1. look to see if the url is a sitemap or sitemap index. If yes, skip the next two steps and just process the site map.
2. If no, see if a sitemap is available at “/sitemap.xml”. If yes, process the sitemap.
3. If still no, look at "/wp-sitemap.xml". If no, you return the error as you already do.

attachments.text:
*Usecase*

We want to offer quick scan results or do a rough scan of lots of pages. For instance, if we expose a test to website visitors to wow them with our scan, we don't necessarily need "deep" scanning using a headless browser.

This issue is meant to look into ways to provide a basic scan, similar to what axe provides with their listing service.
attachments.title: <https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/scan.equalify.app/issues/17|#17 Research Basic, Parser-Based Scanning for Quick Results>

*Usecase*

We want to offer quick scan results or do a rough scan of lots of pages. For instance, if we expose a test to website visitors to wow them with our scan, we don't necessarily need "deep" scanning using a headless browser.

This issue is meant to look into ways to provide a basic scan, similar to what axe provides with their listing service.
